website_summaries.verdict: Quickly assemble this solid rack with clear instructions and no tools.
pros: Sturdy rack holds up to 36 cans and can be easily stacked on top of another rack
Assembly requires no tools and is quick
Includes adjustable plastic dividers to accommodate different sized cans
Slightly angled shelves make all cans clearly visible
cons: Rack maybe too tall for standard pantry shelves, especially when fully loaded

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pantry organization
customer_reviews.text: These racks are easy to put together and sturdy. My pantry is much more organized and looks amazing! These racks have adjustable dividers so almost any size can will fit nicely. Looking forward to buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Regis

customer_reviews.title: Check the size and allow for can as well!
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy product, but my pantry is so big didn't check the size. The entire organizer doesn't fit because it's taller in the back than the front. Then you put your can in it as well and shelf needs to be taller. I would at least allow 16 inches for height and put smaller cans on top. I may have to reorganize and place it on the floor in the pantry?
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my canning jars (Ball Jars). It works great. Very sturdy. As soon as I figure out how to download the photo off my Kindle, I will post the picture. I finally took the time to transfer this image so I could add it to this review. Still loving the rack. It is sturdy. The jar at the top of the rack is the 64 oz size. It fits on the rack sideways but works fine. I still recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic reader

customer_reviews.title: Limited Use - DO NOT use for soda cans
customer_reviews.text: Soda cans will be punctured by the metal ends of the rack on front edge (design flaw). As little as removing a single soda can and allowing the next in line to roll just that far will result directly in punctured soda can and soda ALL OVER.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Stiles

customer_reviews.title: NOT all that functional!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand all the rave reviews on this product. It's difficult to load and unload and I have the skinned knuckles to prove it. It's nearly impossible to see what's behind the first can on the bottom and middle levels, so unless you're storing multiple cans of the same product, it's not at all convenient. Other than the shiny chrome being attractive and apparently strong enough to support the weight of the cans, there are much better options out there. Hassle to order and send back, but more of a hassle to keep it and be annoyed everytime I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzeanna

customer_reviews.title: Quick Easy Smart Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great. Even I could assemble it, and most items like this I find confounding. It does what it shows, I only wish it was deeper and not so tall. Holds 5 cans of corn or beans per row. I pushed the rack to the back of my cabinet and I can see over the cans in front of the rack to those in the rack.
customer_reviews.author: WJD

customer_reviews.title: Busts Soda Cans
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for my bar to hold sodas. It has now busted several cans and left soda to spray all over. The problem is the way it was made tthemetal rods pierce the cans as they roll down. Do not buy if using for sodas. To late to get my money back but hoping I can help others.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy! Holds plenty of cans and really helps get that pantry more organized.
customer_reviews.author: Cherbear

customer_reviews.title: Item damaged, missing pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I order a used one which claimed to be in good condition. One shelf is warped to the the plastic dividers cannot be used on it and it was missing the feet and some other part. I am not returning it because it's too much of a hassle and I can still use this as intended. It will be hidden inside a cabinet. However, I am disappointed in the description. This is not the nice item I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: MansonGirl

customer_reviews.title: Pass...
customer_reviews.text: Not a great design. I purchased for aluminum cans and when they roll down to the front position, sometimes they get punctured by the metal.
customer_reviews.author: space

customer_reviews.title: Ceap cheap cheap
customer_reviews.text: For $20 I was expecting something of better quality. The edges are really rough and sharp and the whole thing didn't sit level until I loaded it up with cans. Definitely recheck how much room you have, it was way too big for our pantry shelves. I would keep looking for something better.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Wald

customer_reviews.title: Fatal flaw - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so this is built sturdily and holds 36 cans with a little extra room in each row. It’s a little too tall for my pantry but I can get over that. This would be a great product if not for one huge problem: if a can bumps the edge anywhere on the unit where metal meets metal, it will create a hole in the can. I lost 4 or five cans that way when setting it up. I now have to lift each can carefully off and make sure the can behind it doesn’t roll to the front too hard or quickly to prevent a puncture. I regret this purchase but too annoying to send back.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Peden

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch, dimensions need to be updated
customer_reviews.text: Second time ordering this product. First time we were quite pleased, would fit 4 cans deep. Concluded to buy 3 more and instead of being 11.5 inches deep like stated online they are now 10.5 inches deep and you can only fit 3 cans now. The way it's setup that's a loss of 9 cans per unit, quite upsetting. Specifically with the price will not be investing more with a shady saler.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Archer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THEM ALL
customer_reviews.text: Buy more than one!! I ordered two and now I am going to come back and get two more because they are incredible. You can adjust the bars so you can use it for small cans like tuna or little cat food, or whatever. I only used a couple of the dividers because they just kind of stay organized without needing them, but it takes a few seconds to put together. My concern was that they would be wobbly because I have to put them on wire shelving, but that was unwarranted. It is sturdy, easy to organize and well above and beyond expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Woodyard

customer_reviews.title: IT WAS TOO DEEP FOR MY UPPER CABINET, WHICH ...
customer_reviews.text: IT WAS TOO DEEP FOR MY UPPER CABINET, WHICH WAS DISAPPOINTING BUT IT DID FIT IN THE LOWER CABINET. FOR FUTURE REFERENCE THE SHELF IS 12.5" DEEP WHEN THE SHELVES ARE PUT ON.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaKat

customer_reviews.title: Simple and inexpensive can rack.
customer_reviews.text: I’d say this can stacker works as advertised. PROS: lightweight, simple to assemble, adjustable dividers, looks better to have cans in a rack than just stacked on the shelf. CONS: hard to see what is in the cans on the bottom and middle racks (see photos), awkward to retrieve a can that is not in front, sharp edges where the ends of the shelf wires meet the front lip puncture thin aluminum (soda) cans! This made a big mess in my pantry as four cans started leaking as they were loaded. I used duct tape (see photo) to cover the sharp edges and it seems to work. Steel soup and bean cans are no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: A can organizer that actually works AND lets you see all the cans!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is already changing my life!!! It's a little tricky to assemble (I recommend doing it on a flat, empty table with good light), but since I love puzzles it worked out. It fits perfectly on my microwave cart (which I foolishly did not measure beforehand--would not have been the product's fault at all if it hadn't fit, but yay it did! But don't count on luck like I did and measure before you buy!!). You can see nearly every can perfectly and they roll out with ease. Sometimes I'll even use the top rack to store english muffins or something like that in one of the sections. Really helping my overall life organization project!
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Very simple system to put together, it is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very simple system to put together, it is a little rickety though. However, it definitely does the job and setup was simple once we figured out the shelves needed to hook to the bottom support bar on each level versus the top support bar. Unfortunately for our particular kitchen, none of our cabinets have enough height to put this organizer into the cabinet, so we have it sitting out on a counter. Not attractive to say the least, but not the product's fault.
customer_reviews.author: cajones8836

customer_reviews.title: Love organization - these work pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Trying to organize a pantry so thought I'd try this product. Hate having cans all over and not knowing what I have.... so, assembled this easily. Start stacking the cans in. First, it fits my pantry shelving perfectly! Second, it holds like 4 1/2 standard size cans... so that last one sort of sits on the edge a little.... thus, the 4 stars on storage capacity. As for sturdiness, it's good, but not 5 star. Not sure how it could be better to get that last star actually because it's nice and light-weight. Wish I had some good guidance for the manufacturer on that one.... But would definately buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michgal1

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold much, takes up a lot of space
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to handle larger cans than my current first in/first out racks will hold. The shelves are too close together to place large cans anywhere but the top, and i had to adjust my pantry shelves for clearance for that to work. I did fit three across on each shelf, but the rows only hold 4 cans max. Compared to my previous can racks, these have half the storage capacity in twice the space. I maintain a well-stocked family pantry and these shelves simply aren't sufficient for our needs. On the plus side, these are sturdy and good looking. It may suit the needs of someone who doesn't need to store as much as my family.
customer_reviews.author: VL

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good product. I ordered one to see how it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good product. I ordered one to see how it would work to organize my pantry. If I had found it acceptable, I would have ordered four more for the rest of the shelves. Unfortunately, I neglected to check the height of the product against the spacing of my pantry shelves - turns out that the product is too tall for all but the top shelf. I'm using it on the top shelf for soups, canned chili, and other canned products, and it's great. If it would fit my other shelf spacing, I would have re-ordered the other four.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Byers

customer_reviews.title: Love an organized pantry
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had purchased these (I purchased 2) organizers years ago. I buy cases of canned goods. I was so tired of having to stack boxes for storing. Sometimes, after opening the boxes some of the cans would roll out, sometimes smashing my toes. I am so pleased with the Can Rack Organizers. We can actually see everything that is in the pantry now. We do not have to move items to see what's behind. The pantry looks neat and organized. I placed the organizers side by side. I do not have enough height to stack them. I love these organizers!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and holds a lot!
customer_reviews.text: This fits so many cans and makes it easy to find what you're looking for! The package arrived quickly and I was able to put together the rack in about 10-15 minutes. It holds most sizes of cans, including big ones (obviously not food-service-big ones). I was able to organize my cans by type because there was enough space to do so. I also don't have to dig through stacks to find the can I want. Fitting this many cans on a shelf would need half the shelf, double-layered, to hold as much. And then you can't see what's in the back. This way I can see everything and get to it easily. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well constructed, and easy to assemble. Careful measuring showed I'd be able to set two of these up side by side. Very close but no cigar... the clear plastic feet on the bottom of each rack were not accounted for. Though not side by side, the racks almost still fit the space - I'm pretty anal and am bummed that they have to sit askew with each other. The rack works fine except the top rack slants up so close to the top of the cupboard space that a can cannot fit at the very back. The plastic dividers are worthless for defining where a can should roll - the tuna cans go where they want.
customer_reviews.author: Maven of Mortar

customer_reviews.title: They work wonderfully in my pantry!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 4 of these a week ago and they were delivered today. Love them! I have a family of 6 plus 3 medium dogs. These are fantastic. 1 of the 4 was broken, so I called customer care and they are amazing. I send a picture of the damaged one and they are sending me a new one. I have dog food and people food on them and its great. They wobble a tiny bit, but once loaded down with canned food sit very nicely on my pantry shelves. I'm ordering 4 more next month, again for the pantry. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to follow the directions and set it up
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to follow the directions and set it up. The reason for the stars deducted is mine came broken. The right side of the arm you unfold outwards has a part at the bottom that wasn't welded together at the arm. After adding the shelves it helped to stabilize it (Or so I hope) in place where it seems sturdy and hopefully its unlikely that my cans will come crashing down on my head.
customer_reviews.author: Shopadelic

customer_reviews.title: it worked great. the peg feet wouldn't work with my wire ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I've been using it for over a year now and it's a game changer! The peg feet wouldn't work with my wire shelving but I just add a thin board beneath. The dividers are wonderful to keep cans from moving out of their spots & they"re adjustable so I am able to rearrange depending on the season/ what I have no hand! I can even fit the large family-size soup cans and mini Campbell's soup cans on the same tier. Very Useful for the multiples I buy!
customer_reviews.author: candy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Helps to organize the space, but hard to access things not in the front or top rack. Not an issue if you have many of the same products, but say you had different kinds of soup that you would want to choose- hard to see. The weight of the cans in the middle rack makes the shelf sag a small amount which can create a minor problem if you have large cans on the bottom one. Too bad it isn’t designed to let the lower racks slide part way out. I imagine that would up the cost though.
customer_reviews.author: KAM

customer_reviews.title: It does the job it claims to do.
customer_reviews.text: While this rack will not survive the Apocalypse, it absolutely supports the 36 cans it claims to do. The two we purchased sit side-by-side on the bottom of a metal shelf. They sit there in a steady manner and because I have placed like-items in each row, it is easy to see what I have and I can retrieve easily.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to organize my very inefficiently constructed pantry, and I'll be honest - I wasn't expecting much. I looked at a lot of other can holders but most were more expensive or very cheaply built. Lucky for me, this one fit the bill, is sturdy as all get out, and it super versatile. I have mine holding a multitude of sizes and it works like a charm. I'll be ordering several more as budget permits. It is surprisingly strong and isn't bowing under the weight at all. It has little plastic flexible pieces to separate the cans from rubbing against each other too, which is a really nice touch and keeps things quiet when I pull cans down.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany M Ludlow

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stack and not as deep as same item bought in 2018
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these can organizers last year and recently purchased another one as I wanted to stack them to have more can space. After I put the new one together (which was super easy), I tried stacking it on top of the one I bought last year. The latest one is not as deep as the one I bought last year so they won’t stack! It also means the new one doesn’t hold as many cans. The whole purpose of buying the second was to stack it as that is the space I have available so I can fit more cans in the same space. I’m also unhappy that the new one isn’t as deep.
customer_reviews.author: Cathrine

customer_reviews.title: Not an effective use of space, not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The rack is a bit wobbly which is to be expected for $20. The product photo is misleading. Only the top rack can hold large cans (30 oz). It can fit 2 large and one regular sized can (15 oz). If you put three 15 oz cans on in one row there are several inches of wasted space as you can see in my picture. There’s just enough extra space to not fit anything. As pictured on the bottom row of my picture you can fit 4 small cans (7 oz) in one row. I thought this rack would utilize my pantry space more effectively but I can fit more cans on the pantry shelf by stacking them.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with it
customer_reviews.text: I received my rack earlier today and set it up straight away. We were in desperate need for something to organize our pet food cans with. The rack has 3 sloped shelves that are canted forward. Each shelf is large enough to store 12 regular sized cans (actually it's bigger, but I don't know how many larger cans it can hold). In total it can store 36 regular sized cans (3+ wide and 4+ deep per shelf). It's well constructed and even came with spare rubber feet and spare caps for the ends of the racks.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Day

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well
customer_reviews.text: This rack improved the space utilization of our pantry by stacking cans in an easy roll-out dispensing system. Because of the slanted shelves, the next can is ready to pick out. Best for full-sized 14 to 16 oz cans, but can also be used for some smaller ones. My only complaint (and it's a small one) would be that in most situations, you can only load from the front, which means that dispensing is Last In First Out. The result is that oldest cans stay in back unless you pull them out to put newer ones in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J. Lodholm

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, wish it was bigger
customer_reviews.text: I really like this for organizing canned food, I just wish it was bigger rather than having to buy multiples. The set up is pretty easy as long as you follow the instructions (I didn't bother reading them at first and was confused for a bit). Mine are fully loaded almost all the time with oversize cans on the top and I haven't had any issues with the rack bending or the pieces coming undone or anything so it's about as sturdy as it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Liu

customer_reviews.title: Best Can Rack
customer_reviews.text: I had a plastic can rack a few years ago and hated it because it kept coming apart. I even tried to super glue the thing together, ugh. This SimpleHouseware Stackable Can Rack is awesome!! I’ve been needing this to help sort and organize my canned goods. Works great because I have a large shelving unit. Certainly will consider adding additional units should I become obsessed with buying caseloads of canned goods. Why not? Not I’ve the storage!! <wink, wink>
customer_reviews.author: Diane A. Von Aspern

customer_reviews.title: Love kitchen organization!
customer_reviews.text: Measure your cabinet space before purchasing. I was surprised to find it didn't fit in some of my cabinet spaces so I had to move things around. No big deal but I would have felt like a big dolt if it didn't fit in any of them. Easily assembled. I put this together in about 10 minutes. It comes with instruction but it's pretty easy to figure out. Had I not been so concentrated on the instructions I probably could have assembled it on my own in 5. Empty, it feels unstable but once you roll your cans in, it stabilizes.
customer_reviews.author: ShopTilliDrop

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: It works just as ot should, and better than I expected! It is much heavier and high quality then I thought it was looking at the pictures. The dividers that came with it are nice but I found them personally unneeded.This fits a lot of cans I also use this as a shelf of sorts so other items are stacked on top of the cans. This is sturdy and is holding up very nicely!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, great organizer
customer_reviews.text: Edited: June 2020. Went ahead and ordered my second one of these and now my pantry really looks like a grocery store! 😂 Seriously, if you have the room and need to organize, get one or two of these. They are sturdy, well made, and really make a difference. Had this on my wish list forever, finally purchased for my big pantry overhaul. So happy I finally got this. Holds 36 cans, no problem. Fits perfectly on my shelf. Debating if I should get another one. Easy assembly, too. All in all, a great product to help organize your foodstuffs.
customer_reviews.author: Deezy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My canned food shelf is now very organized so this accomplished its purpose. I can more easily find whatever type of canned foods I am looking for. I am able to fit 12 standard 14-16oz cans on each row (for a total of 36) but to be honest it is a tight squeeze. My cans never fit the same as is shown in the picture - the ones in the back are always kind of just resting on the other cans and don't go into the shelf all the way
customer_reviews.author: LZ

customer_reviews.title: Loved the functionality of this product.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the functionality of this product. It fit easily in my pantry and took me less than 5 min to put together (all by myself) There is some space like an inch or so left on either side of the cans and at first I thought it was oversized but soon realized u need the space to restock and to remove. So this is a well done product. ( I purchased the silver one ) hope this helps. Please feel free to ask any questions about the product.
customer_reviews.author: LaShanda Babbs

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to assemble unit
customer_reviews.text: This shelf organizer is very sturdy and easy to assemble. However, read the dimensions carefully. I did not and found that my 12" high shelves were too short to accommodate the nearly 14"+ inches required to accommodate the unit with cans inside. Even without cans you need about a 14 inch height to your shelf. It did not work for me, however is you have the correct dimensions, this is a sturdy unit that would hold a lot of cans. If it fit, I would have given it 5 stars. But it was my fault for not reading carefully.
customer_reviews.author: WHIMSY GIRL

customer_reviews.title: Fine product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my husband thinks we need to store up on beans and chili (in case of an apocalypse or zombie takeover? So many cans!) and I thought for my sanity that I would buy an organization system for them. This is a very durable, setup was easy (and I'm horrible with directions) but it didn't bring about the desired aesthetics for me, plus it actually has taken up more space than less (which makes sense if you think about it). Since you place the tracks, I can see this being fine for cans of varying sizes, which is what I have, but it still doesn't perfectly fit everything I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Ann Forsgren

customer_reviews.title: Good and well made
customer_reviews.text: I like the can racks they hold about 36 standard size cans. They are easy to assemble and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper 13

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and versatile! Holds more than just cans
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I lived without this before I had it. I've had it for a few months now and it's still holding up. I like that the plastic dividers are adjustable and even removable, so I can hold more than just standard cans in it. I sometimes use it for boxes if I need the space and don't have a lot of can. Would highly recommend and am considering getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: Mar-Bar

customer_reviews.title: Needed some adjustment but works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It is 1" too wide for my pantry selfs. House is over 120 years old. Everything I buy has to be modified in some way. I mounted the back of rack to wall of pantry to keep it from falling off front of shelf. This is much better method of storing canned goods and keeps my pantry more organized.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus2007

customer_reviews.title: Diggin this organizer!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I have way too much in my pantry. I guess I buy things that I forget I already have-you do that too, don't you? So I decided to try to get at least one aspect of my life organized-my cans! This is very space efficient, and it's easy to see what canned goods I have on hand because of the design of this. Also, it was very easy to assemble-I didn't even have to read the directions. Great space-saving purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Hank's my dog

customer_reviews.title: A must have for organizing the pantry. A+
customer_reviews.text: This item has made me so organized. I absolutely love it. I don’t know what I did before this in regards to organization. It’s really easy to assemble, it probably took me five minutes. Super sturdy and a must have, the price point is really good too. Thank you for organizing my pantry, I have a box full of canned goods and now I have an organize shelf for
customer_reviews.author: Gloss

customer_reviews.title: Great organization product
customer_reviews.text: My cabinets were super unorganized so I wanted to tame some of the space by putting the cans in an organizer. It took me 10 mins to put together really simple step by step instructions. The organizer is awesome but it only takes up part of the cabinet so I would measure because there’s a lot of space behind it because I don’t want to push it all away back in the cabinet of open space so I pull it forward so that I can see everything that’s in there. That’s really my only issue and it’s only because I don’t have one of those pull out cabinets. But the product itself has served it’s purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Fits the need
customer_reviews.text: I should have checked the dimensions before purchasing as it was too tall to put where I wanted to. Found somewhere else to put it so I assembled it. Somewhat confusing instructions on assembly, but I figured it out. Front side of shelves does not snap in to place, so it seems like it may not be that supportive when full of cans, but weight of cans should help to lock in the shelves, so they should be alright. The plastic dividers don't seem to sit right. Overall, useful, but I would have preferred them to be a little sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Richard F.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT SOLUTION FOR CAN STORAGE!
customer_reviews.text: We moved and I’m adapting to a new smaller kitchen. Pantry space has changed greatly for me. I saw immediately that can storage was going to be an issue and looked for solutions. I chose this product. WOW!!! I went from having way too many cans, most of which I couldn’t even see, to having room for WAY more! Makes me smile when I open pantry now!
customer_reviews.author: Oystergirl

customer_reviews.title: and easily get to it at feeding time
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these stacked together on our kitchen counter to hold all of our canned dog food. It allows us to unpack all of our canned food, keep it where we can see it, and easily get to it at feeding time. It is sturdy enough to stack (we just stack 2) and sturdy enough to hold a month's worth of canned dog food for 2 large dogs. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara J

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase considering buying a second
customer_reviews.text: I wanted another option to keep my shelves from collapsing because the centers were bowing from the weight of cans. I feel the price Is a little steep but otherwise this is a great product. Very handy at freeing shelf space. Doesnt explain well how to assemble but Isnt too difficult to figure out.Can fit quite a few cans comes with optional dividers but they are flimsy and dont stay well.
customer_reviews.author: Just Niki

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Needed to organize my pantry and this product is great. If you look at the instruction diagram before you put it together it literally takes just minutes to assemble. Seems sturdy so far. I bought 2, 1 is full the other is partially full. It fits most can sizes on bottom and middle rack and any size can on the top. The one draw back is you have to load cans from the front. Very happy with this organizational product.
customer_reviews.author: Dvegso

customer_reviews.title: I love em!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these stackable organizers. I purchased 2 and probably going to purchase more. I have organized my pantry with them and it created alot more room and I don't have cans stacked that increases the chances of them falling to the ground. I wish my shelves could hold them stacked, but I use them side by side.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: The plastic scalloped things divide the cans into rows on each level.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, the directions should tell you to put the no slip feet on first. If you are going to stack another unit on top, you don’t need The feet on the upper units. They were more difficult to put on after the unit was assembled because the shelves will move. The feet should be put on sideways then turned downwards.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Great to get your canned goods organized
customer_reviews.text: Really like this rack to organize my cans. I have limited space and it wasn't working to have to stack cans 4 or 5 deep. The racks come partially assembled but there were some clips put on wrong so my husband had to do some reconfiguring to get them to go together like they were supposed to. They are a little flimsy and I'm not sure how well they would do stacked but they work perfectly fine on their own. Overall happy with my purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PanicPrincess

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out
customer_reviews.text: For one, let's list my faults.. didn't check dimensions so it doesn't fit in our pantry or our cabinet shelves (obviously my fault yet still irritating.) That put aside the instructions were absolutely ridiculous. One side would pop in simply the other had to completely be forced! All in all though, sure, it does great for holding canned food. Either sending back or reselling.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Scheurman

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy, they made these shorter and they hold less cans
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an additional one of these to have next to my other one. So I bought the same exact one so it will match! Only to find out it is 1" shorter than the one I bought last time! Since it is 1" shorter it holds 9 cans less then my other one! So disappointing, sending it back and mad because I wont be able to find one to match my first one.
customer_reviews.author: Vfam

customer_reviews.title: Cans Do Not Fit - Horrible Organizer
customer_reviews.text: I've never been so disappointed in a product in my life. I love to have my kitchen organized and, sure, it does hold cans. However, it will not fit four cans in one row. The depth is too short and they do not sit flat. There are only 6 plastic divider pieces (one of which is already broken). They move freely and so won't help keep cans in order. If you try to put in cans such as tuna or 4 oz. (diced green chilis) the can is small and just falls through the wires.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda L Genaro

customer_reviews.title: I finally organized my pantry!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these racks and they hold so much. The dividers can be moved to accommodate practically any size can or jar you want. So much easier to see my supply of any item (for my shopping list) and I don't have to worry about anything falling over on the shelves when I can now easily grab one item off the rack. Everything looks so neat when I open my pantry door now.
customer_reviews.author: Pat G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, holds a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these organizers. They were extremely easy to put together. I have decreased dexterity due hand and wrist issues but I could do with minimal difficulty. They do indeed hold about 36 cans each. They do feel a little wobbly so load your cans carefully to distribute the weight evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these initially, and ended up going back for a total of 6. Stacking cans vertically gave me so much more room for storage. It definitely looks better. I also like the fact that I can now see at a glance what items I need to add to my grocery list. And it's easier to find items when needed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Friske

customer_reviews.title: I love being organized! These shelves save me time and anxiety of not being able to readily find what I need when I need it.
customer_reviews.text: We have very little storage and high cabinets that I used to have to grab a step-stool to just to find the can that I needed hiding behind the ones I didn't need. Now I have my cans organized in rows on Amazon shelving units and I can readily see and grab what I need without the step-stool. A huge time saver for me. It is easy to put together and sturdy. Be sure to assemble it in the place where you will store things. Once it is filled it is very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Callahan

customer_reviews.title: THIS Brings Me JOY!
customer_reviews.text: Okay - I'm a dork, but this makes me feel SUPER organized! My pantry has never looked so awesome!!! This is a pretty heavy-duty rack. You will want to take a little care when putting it together to make sure the shelves run the correct direction, but once you get the first one, it's easy. I would consider getting more of these for my Costco shelves in the garage, and it appears that you can easily stack multiple shelves if you use a lot of canned goods. Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy in Boise

customer_reviews.title: Very organized and neat!
customer_reviews.text: This rack has allowed me to really organize my pantry shelves. The cans are easily seen in the top rack and can be easily viewed from the front of the lower levels. They were easy to put together and look very professional on the shelf. I bought two and love them. They are holding up well. I have no complaints
customer_reviews.author: susan rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good for organizing!
customer_reviews.text: Size wise it’s kind of awkward for pantry’s. We have an extra storage area in our basement though and I had bought three of these and they worked perfectly down there to help us organize our overflow!! Very easy to put together and while they feel kind of flimsy, they hold a lot of weight without issues!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I love this can rack! It was very easy to set up. I was tired of my can goods being stacked all on the floor and I would forget what I had, or my baby would knock over a small stack. This was so nice I went back and ordered another one to stack on top. The higher you stack though you have to anchor because it can become wobbly. But that is common sense to make sure you stack properly. I would recommend if u need some organization in your pantry or cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchase

customer_reviews.title: More
customer_reviews.text: This item is amazing, and I am glad that I brought two. They stack so I can see everything. I don't have to worry about stacking them on top of each other and falling down to only have to stack them again. They are easy to put in and take out. No fuss no mess. I highly recommend this item to anyone with or without a storage problem. They are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased another brand and had to return because it didn't hold the cans very well and started to bend because of the weight. After returning the old one and purchasing this one, I am so pleased. The metal is sturdy enough to hold more than 10 cans without bending or distorting. Very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: CiciSoSweet

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Have a soup aisle in your kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Turned out to be way sturdier than I expected, and simple to put together. We have 36 neatly arranged cans of soup now, so we don't need to go out in the snow because someone forgot to shop. I'm saving up to buy another one. If you put it on a wire rack it's pretty heavy full, so put a board under it to distribute the weight. Much neatens the food storage area.Holds Campbell's condensed and ready to eat soups, vegetable cans, and adjusts to fit smaller cans like tuna or deviled ham. Great way to keep cans rotated for freshness.
customer_reviews.author: AuntMary

customer_reviews.title: Pass on it
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the quality of this product and am returning it. I had bought a different one the first time and assumed I was ordering the same item. This one is only$2 less then the other brand and I thought I'd be saving money. Don't bother. This one is flimsy with cheap finishes.
customer_reviews.author: Susan McCann

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to put together...the brackets that came attached, were place on the frame backwards and cannot be turned around. I DID NOT KNO THIS WHEN I STARTED. I laid al the parts out in open place and began following instructions to put together. I realized when I thought I was almost finished that it was backwards. I waited for my son to come to town and help. He took apart what I had done and started over and quickly saw the problem. By then, I had run out of time to return for refund. I waisted $23
customer_reviews.author: jan h.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small pantry
customer_reviews.text: This fit the bottom of my 18" wide pantry and helped to organize my can goods. It was easy to assemble once you figured out the pictures. The pictures were hard to figure out, but basically its snap into place once you figure out where it goes. As far as durability, I won't know that until I've had it awhile, but it seems plenty strong for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia E. Downes

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: What's there to say? It looks nice, it does what it's supposed to do. We always had those cans stacked three high; doing that used less space than the rack does, but it really isn't any more visible. And then there are always those cans that don't stack (the bottoms aren't designed to stack one on another). This just looks more attractive. Other than the really small cans (such as olive slices, chili peppers, chipotle peppers), the rack adjusts nicely for different size cans - or even small jars.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for canned food. Ithas not fallen apart and can withstand the weight if the cans. Cans dont roll from the top rack to the bottom. Each is a shelf and you can fit 3 cans across and squeeze 4 cans deep. They don't all lay flat I'm the shelf though. It works and does store more food than just stacking and hoping the don't fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Cristen L Fischl

customer_reviews.title: This is a great organizer for cans!!!
customer_reviews.text: You can see all your cans and if you have bigger cans, they still fit! Adjustable shelves depending on how tall your cans are. It made my food storage much more manageable. I never could tell what I had behind that first row of cans. Now I know exactly what I have. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: The girl next door

customer_reviews.title: shelves not secure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand and another brand. What I like about this one is that is that the bottom has rubber protectors and will not scratch my shelves. What I dislike is that the shelves just hook onto the sides and are not secure. If you try to move the rack, they can come loose. I bought another brand, and their shelves are screwed in for a much more stable design
customer_reviews.author: llmjazz

customer_reviews.title: Can't see items.
customer_reviews.text: Good space saver. Problem occurs when items are not the same on bottom shelves, you will have to remove several cans to retrieve one you want.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina V

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my cans organized!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a sea of cans taking up two shelves but now they are neatly condensed into a smaller space. I love that the rows are adjustable. I can have family size Cambell’s Cans, large pineapple cans, small tomato cans and regular size olive cans all on the same rack! I don’t keep a ton of cans food so this easily fit all of my cans with space to spare! Good quality, feels sturdy. I really love it!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: It came bent, but overall a great product.
customer_reviews.text: This product had a bent piece but I made it work. It’s sturdy, fits on my pantry shelf. Overall I really like it. The bent piece looks like it came from the factory like that. I decided to keep it because it worked. A little disappointed, but overall it’s a great addition to my pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Mimialready

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: This is bigger than I thought it would be, but fits well in my pantry. Easy assembly if you read the directions, it’s just a matter of putting in the shelves and plastic partitions. Fits several cans and doesn’t show any signs of coming apart. If I ate more canned food I would probably order a few of these for my garage storage, but one was enough for me!
customer_reviews.author: Chimney161Top Contributor: Minecraft

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble..sturdy...
customer_reviews.text: just what was needed....sturdy wire...large capacity...we live far from the grocery store so have a well stocked pantry that needed organization...these were perfect...they accept a large assortment of can sizes with the top rack allowing the largest of cans...yes up to coffee can big 😊 did use a few tie staps to link them for extra sturdy construction. Highly recommend...wife was very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Tazz Man

customer_reviews.title: I love this rack!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these racks for my small pantry and received them overnight. They were easy to put together but not as sturdy as I had hoped they would be. They will however work fine for what I need them for. My shelves are just barley 14 1/2" tall so it was a tight squeeze getting them to fit. In order to utilize the top rack, I put it in as a low profile level for flat cans and double stacked the cans on the second level. The third level I used as pictured. For the money, they are good little racks.
customer_reviews.author: Polly Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, a little small
customer_reviews.text: The rack has some nice touches, like plastic feet to protect the surface you put it on, rubber tips for the exposed wire ends, and the ability to stack. However, it should be about 1" deeper. It says 36 cans, but that's only true if they are smaller than typical 15oz tomato sauce cans or canned beans. You can only fit 3 per slot of those for a total of 27 cans.
customer_reviews.author: DKB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with wire shelving unit.
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy and does not work in a pantry that has wire shelves. To much weight and causes the shelf to bow. Too tall to be used on the wire shelves so you could only use 2 of the 3 shelves and still in bowed. May work on a different shelf system, but not the wire shelve units.
customer_reviews.author: Rease

customer_reviews.title: Ready for an apocolypse!
customer_reviews.text: This really helped me organize and I actually could fit more stuff in the pantry because how hight can you actually stack soup cans? lol. This made it so we could see what we had, kept freshest stuff to the back and can be stack one on another. Now cooking has one less hurdle to overcome. Everything is right there, easy to take off the rack and easy to reload.
customer_reviews.author: G-I Jane

customer_reviews.title: Need actual rack measurement
customer_reviews.text: The depth of the rack was listed as two different measurements in the product information. Wasn’t sure which was correct. We received this company’s rack for Christmas and assumed there was only one depth since the picture showed it would accommodate 4 regular sized cans and the ones we received at Christmas accommodates 4 cans (in depth). In fact, the new ones we just received accommodate only 3 cans. This was a disappointment. I have since researched to see if I could get a deeper rack — like those at Christmas and I can’t find that option — disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Deckard

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: If you’re going to put this in your pantry be sure to measure and make sure there’s enough space first because it was too big to fit in any shelves in my pantry. Other than that not a bad product. Fairly sturdy and has good storage capacity. There’s nothing in particular I love About this product and I could probably live without it
customer_reviews.author: ashton hermetz

customer_reviews.title: The Rack that Rocks
customer_reviews.text: This rack was just what I need to help organize my pantry (trying to avoid stacking cans vertically). It was easy to put together and I had no problems snapping in the plastic dividers that goes between the rows of each shelf. It hold 36 cans beautifully, especially considering that the cans contain dense material (dog food - a different flavor on each shelf). I have not noted any sagging of the unit, nor have I experienced any tipping when removing cans. There is just a slight enough tilt to let the cans move gently forward without rolling out of the rack altogether. This is a good, sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: LAM2lake

customer_reviews.title: Great, adjustable can organizer
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect! Recently organizing my pantry, I was on the look out for a can goods organizer and came across this one. Holds a wide variety of sized cans, which is a huge bonus compared to other can organizers. It was easy to put together, adjustable rubber spaces on the shelves to give you the perfect fit. A great bonus was the inclusion of the rubber feet for the bottom to prevent it from moving on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Real Housewife of Bel Air

customer_reviews.title: Great for organizing the pantry.
customer_reviews.text: Having recently downsized from a home that had a pantry that was big enough to rent to a family of four (just kidding) it was important to organize the limited space we had in our new smaller home. This product fit our needs perfectly. Sturdy, well built and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great rack!
customer_reviews.text: This rack does the trick! No more digging through stacks of cans or coming up empty when you *swear* you had one more can of whatever! This rack went together smoothly and has adjustable guides meaning cans of all sizes can coexist happily!
customer_reviews.author: evilratgoddess

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is easy, storage is good, sturdy enough awkward to move.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together but sturdiness is questionable. The sides and back are all connected with hinges so they swing open. The shelves are then places in the rails on the sides and this is how it is held in place . There are no pins or screws to keep the shelves in place. Assuming it is not moved often the product works. And hold the max cans no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kiyoko

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and great storage
customer_reviews.text: This is great for storage of cans. I don't usually put things together but I was surprised how easily I was able to do it. This gave me extra room on shelves where my cans are usually stored. It was perfect and much easier to see the cans. So much easier than stacking the cans on the shelf. The shelves slant forward so when a can is removed the rest move forward. There are plastic dividers between the cans that are adjustable to the size of the can.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great Organizer
customer_reviews.text: The cans in our pantry cabinet were stacked up so we could not even tell what we had. This rack has made a huge difference. The cans are now up where they can be seen in an organized fashion. Made a huge difference in the cabinet. The rack was fairly simple to put together. It is holding 36 cans with no problem so it sturdy. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great system
customer_reviews.text: I should have measured height inside the cabinet, as I might not have purchased, but I really love the organizer itself. It was easy to put together, and holds a lot. Even with limited access to the top shelf, this is much easier than trying to dig through the shelf to find the can I want.,
customer_reviews.author: Boot Lover

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second it works so well
customer_reviews.text: This is not simple to assemble, but it is sturdy and works great. I bought the first one about 4 months ago. I have mine set for two rows to hold standard size cans and the third to hold the bigger cans. Many cans have passed through in those months, and it still holds steady. I store my most used vegetables there so all the food in each row is the same. Each row holds 3 cans easily. The smaller cans hold 4 if you hike the back one up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: SimpleHouseware Stackable Can Rack
customer_reviews.text: This little gizmo more than met the need! This was the third one purchased in order to organize my pantry. They fit side by side and I can adjust them to hold everything from cans to boxed goods. Keeps everything at my fingertips and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S.

customer_reviews.title: I can find my cans!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised that the can rack was sturdy chromed metal instead of chromed plastic. The can rack holds tons of cans and organized my cupboard so I can easily find what I'm looking for. Quality organization for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kitt

product_meta.title: SimpleHouseware Stackable Can Rack Organizer, Chrome
feature_bullets: Stackable design: get multiple sets and stack them together in a second
Store up to 36 can or variety size can/jars
Six adjustable plastic dividers get different size can, jars, Beverage can aligned and organized
Assembled in a minute and no hardware needed, sturdy construction, Chrome finish
Dimension: 17''W x 11. 5''D x 14"H (Minimum 15"H required for regular cans); USPTO Patent No: US10051979B2

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,128 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
